CIPHER.173.cipherString: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.
CIPHER.173.question: A quote by Henry Ward Beecher has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.173.author: Henry Ward Beecher

CIPHER.165.cipherString: A zebra does not change its spots.
CIPHER.165.question: The following quote by Al Gore needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=19 and b=3.
CIPHER.165.author: Al Gore

CIPHER.166.cipherString: A wise man is he who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
CIPHER.166.question: A quote by Epictetus has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word THOSE.
CIPHER.166.author: Epictetus

CIPHER.167.cipherString: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
CIPHER.167.question: The following quote by Hippocrates needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of MAINE and polybius key of MAGNITUDE.
CIPHER.167.author: Hippocrates

CIPHER.151.cipherString: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
CIPHER.151.question: The following quote by James Thurber needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of PAUSE
CIPHER.151.author: James Thurber

CIPHER.163.cipherString: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
CIPHER.163.question: The following quote by Dalai Lama needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of JOKES and polybius key of PUBLISHED.
CIPHER.163.author: Dalai Lama

CIPHER.160.cipherString: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed on an equal or greater benefit.
CIPHER.160.question: A quote by Napoleon Hill has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.160.author: Napoleon Hill

CIPHER.169.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 450 6125 619 82337. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.159.cipherString: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.
CIPHER.159.question: Decode this quote by David Hume which has been encoded using the Atbash Cipher.
CIPHER.159.author: David Hume

CIPHER.172.cipherString: Un sue√±o no se hace realidad por arte de magia, necesita sudor, determinaci√≥n y trabajo duro.
CIPHER.172.question: A quote by Colin Powell in Spanish has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. It has been encoded using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.172.author: Colin Powell
CIPHER.172.translation: A dream doesn't come true by magic, it takes sweat, determination and hard work.

CIPHER.155.cipherString: Everything seems simpler from a distance.
CIPHER.155.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Gail Tsukiyama using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.155.author: Gail Tsukiyama

CIPHER.154.cipherString: I'm not scared of anything in particular, but I am motivated by a fear of failure as opposed to a need to succeed.
CIPHER.154.question: A quote by Heston Blumenthal has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.154.author: Heston Blumenthal

CIPHER.161.cipherString: Try not to have a good time... this is supposed to be educational.

CIPHER.168.cipherString: wee mussed knot taek hte faults of hour oyuth into our lod age; for old age brings with it it's own defects.
CIPHER.168.question: Decode a quote by Goethe that was encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher.  Unfortunately the message was received over a bad connection, so there are some errors in it.
CIPHER.168.author: Goethe

CIPHER.157.cipherString: Learning passes for wisdom among them who want both.
CIPHER.157.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Sir W. Temple using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.157.author: Sir W. Temple

CIPHER.153.cipherString: When you set your mind to achieve something, you must allow yourself the opportunity to get it done.
CIPHER.153.question: Decode this quote by Tasha Hoggatt which has been encoded using the Caesar Cipher.
CIPHER.153.author: Tasha Hoggatt

CIPHER.164.cipherString: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it.
CIPHER.164.question: The following strange phrases encode a quote by Old Testament using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the cipher text ALONG SHINY STOCK BOXES decodes to be THAT.
CIPHER.164.author: Old Testament

CIPHER.170.cipherString: Breakthroughs arise when someone can combine many ideas together. Think broadly, not deeply.
CIPHER.170.question: A quote by Joshua Krook has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word CAN.
CIPHER.170.author: Joshua Krook

CIPHER.158.cipherString: I hope when I inevitably choke to death on gummy bears people just say I was killed by bears and leave it at that.
CIPHER.158.question: A quote by an unknown person has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it ends with the word THAT.
CIPHER.158.author: Unknown

CIPHER.150.cipherString: It has been my philosophy of life that difficulties vanish when faced boldly.
CIPHER.150.question: A quote by Isaac Asimov has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has IFETHAT somewhere in it.
CIPHER.150.author: Isaac Asimov

CIPHER.156.cipherString: Failure is when you give up. A real winner is someone that doesn't give up, even when it feels like they are losing.
CIPHER.156.question: A quote by Joshua Hartzell has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it contains the word YOU.
CIPHER.156.author: Joshua Hartzell

CIPHER.152.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 85046 0461 584937 23981. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.171.cipherString: When you encounter difficulties and contradictions, do not try to break them, but bend them with gentleness and time.
CIPHER.171.question: A quote by Saint Francis de Sales has been encoded using the K2 Patristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told it starts with WHEN Y.
CIPHER.171.author: Saint Francis de Sales

CIPHER.162.cipherString: Many books owe their success to the good memories of their authors and the bad memories of their readers.
CIPHER.162.question: A quote by Charles Caleb Colton has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.162.author: Charles Caleb Colton
